body_text:
sinon tries to find a global object in a few different ways, one of which is looking for self. It throws an error if you don't have this, and the other places that load sinon during xpcshell tests that I could find all have something similar (That's where I copied this from, in fact).
This could use an explaining comment, though.
body:
sinon tries to find a global object in a few different ways, one of which is looking for `self`. It throws an error if you don't have this, and [the other places that load sinon during xpcshell tests](https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/search?q=sinon-1.16&=mozilla-central) that I could find all have something similar (That's where I copied this from, in fact).

This could use an explaining comment, though.
body_html:
sinon tries to find a global object in a few different ways, one of which is looking for self. It throws an error if you don't have this, and the other places that load sinon during xpcshell tests that I could find all have something similar (That's where I copied this from, in fact).

This could use an explaining comment, though.
